tool.name: Medibang
tool.explain: Medibang is a free digital art program. I've used it for all my artworks since 2017.

tool.name: Gaomon Tablet
tool.explain: I use a Gaomon pen tablet to make it easier to draw on my computer.

tool.name: Unsplash
tool.explain: While not used in any of the examples I provided, I occasionally use public domain images as textures for my art or when I need to make a website. Unsplash is a good example.

tool.name: Capcut
tool.explain: Capcut is a free video editing program. It's very simple and easy to use, as well as offerring free assets. I personally avoid the AI features.

tool.name: Mixkit
tool.explain: Like Unsplash, I occasionally use their free assets for video projects (also not shown in any of the examples I provided).

tool.name: Visual Studio Code
tool.explain: The free alternative to Dreamweaver that I use for web development. It doesn't have as much features, but it does the job well.
tool.link: • Link to Visual Studio Code's official website
